body.p: There's been a tremendous amount of work going into Gentoo Linux in the past few months, and Gentoo Linux 1.0_rc6 has become, well, pretty amazing. Very refined, and lots of new capabilities and fixes have been added. Here is an incomplete list: New 2.4.16 kernel with ACPI, XFS, LVM, low latency and preemptive kernel patches, a new binutils to fix Athlon and PIII-specific instruction compilation problems -- resulting in rock-solid kernels even when configured for higher-end CPU types, a new Portage release that allows you to safely upgrade glibc even while you're in X without causing any applications to segfault or otherwise mess up, a completely reworked and improved install CD that supports installation to LVM, software RAID, ext2, ext3, ReiserFS and XFS filesystems, and much more. Oh, our new glibc includes a fix for the recent glibc "glob" security hole. And, of course, the latest NVIDIA drivers and a very fast and stable platform to run them on, not to mention around 1100 ports-based packages in total, and still counting.
